catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 882
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: small earthenware cup with lid; cup has upward hooking handle on side and slightly protruding collar for lid; lid has small knob at top
provenance: Gift from Keum Ja Kang, 1986, to Mary Burke
text: Even after the introduction of the climbing kiln in the early fourth century, Korean potters continued to make low-fired earthenware in addition to more durable stoneware.
title: Small lidded jar with handle
